summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by a U.S. Magistrate Judge authorizing the forensic search of 62 electronic devices seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties. The devices were seized during his arrest and from searches of his New York residence and private island. The warrant authorizes a search for evidence related to sex trafficking and conspiracy crimes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary subject of the investigation; electronic devices were seized from his person and his residences in New York and the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Specifically named in the warrant as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein; the search seeks evidence of communications with her.

persons.name: Gabriel W. Gorenstein
persons.context: The judge who signed and issued the search and seizure warrant.

connections.description: The warrant explicitly identifies Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Epstein in the subject offenses.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI, and two electronic devices (an iPad and iPhone) were seized from his person.

events.title: Search of 9 East 71st Street
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's New York City residence, resulting in the seizure of 33 electronic devices.

events.title: Search of Little Saint James
events.description: Law enforcement searched Epstein's private island in the U.S. Virgin Islands, resulting in the seizure of 27 electronic devices.

events.title: Warrant Issued
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Gabriel W. Gorenstein issued the search warrant authorizing forensic examination of the seized devices.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY (Epstein's New York residence)
Little Saint James, U.S. Virgin Islands (Epstein's private island)
keyFacts: A total of 62 electronic devices were seized from Jeffrey Epstein and his properties for forensic examination.
The warrant explicitly names Ghislaine Maxwell as a co-conspirator of Jeffrey Epstein.
The search seeks evidence of crimes including sex trafficking of minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 1591) and conspiracy, covering the period from 1994 to August 8, 2019.
The warrant authorizes a search for communications, financial records, travel documents, and photographs related to victims and co-conspirators.
The document indicates the investigation was active and seeking expansive digital evidence nearly a year after Epstein's arrest and death.
